CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruby Dean Flowers, barmaid, Hill District and Miss Joyce McKenzie, nurse, Western Maryland, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 2, 1961, pg. 7 with question: " Do you think police could wipe out all the rackets if they launched an intense, earnest campaign against vice and crime?" Mrs. Flower's answer reads: "I think they could do it for a while, but there are so many important people involved higher up that it would just crop up again, unless this was a continuous thing."  Ms. McKenzie's answer reads: "I just don't think it would be possible.  I imagine there are too many people involved in it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ruby Dean Flowers wearing light colored button down collared shirt with "R" monogram, standing in front of glass block window; Portrait of Joyce McKenzie wearing plaid skirt and sunglasses, standing with Courier reporter writing in notebook, standing in front of automobiles and buildings
